meanings.definition: Of or relating to an epidemic.
meanings.sent1: The epidemical disease quickly spread throughout the town.
meanings.sent2: The government took action to prevent the epidemical outbreak from worsening.
meanings.sent3: The epidemical flu made everyone in the office sneeze at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The epidemical fear of the virus was more contagious than the illness itself.
meanings.sent5: The epidemical nature of the virus was evident in how rapidly it affected the population.

meanings.definition: Spreading rapidly and extensively by infection and affecting many individuals in an area or a population.
meanings.sent1: The epidemical spread of rumors caused chaos in the small town.
meanings.sent2: The epidemical flu outbreak led to school closures.
meanings.sent3: The epidemical laughter in the room was contagious and soon everyone was smiling.
meanings.sent4: The epidemical growth of the plant took over the entire garden.
meanings.sent5: The epidemical impact of the storm left a trail of destruction in its path.
